page.title: 15LLANBISTER, FLORA AND FAUNA
page.content: Intensive grazing restricts the growth of wild flowers. A few rough headlands have the common spotted and the heath spotted orchid. In spring, Primroses abound and Lady's Smock in wet areas attract orange tipped butterflies. Yellow Rock Rose is on the common with Milk Wort pushing blue flowers through the stunted Gorse. Verges,hedge bottoms and banks house Foxglove,Campion,Herb Robert,Harebell, Betony and Vetches. Hedgerows have Bird Cherry,Crab Apple,Elder and Bullace Fruit. In late summer Knapweed attract Peacock,Red Admiral,Tortoise Shell and Common Blue butterflies. Mushrooms and other fungi abound. Pipistrelle and Longeared bats are present. Glow worms are in a few isolated places. Common are Badgers,Foxes,Moles,Stoats,Weasels Rabbits,Hares,Moles,Hedgehogs and Mice
